Key Match Events: Ja Morant scored 20 points before leaving in the third quarter with a right hamstring injury.
Rookie Jaylen Wells and Jaren Jackson Jr. also scored 20 points each for the Grizzlies.
LeBron James led the Lakers with 39 points.
Austin Reaves added 19 points despite going 2 for 9 from 3-point range.
Memphis held a 72-68 lead in the third quarter when reserve Jay Huff connected on three consecutive 3-pointers, then capped the run off with an offensive rebound leading to a reverse dunk.
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers played without starting center Anthony Davis, who was suffering from left heel soreness.
Rui Hachimura was also out with an illness, giving rookie Dalton Knect from Tennessee his first NBA start.
Grizzlies coach Taylor Jenkins missed the game because of a death in the family. Assistant coach Tuomas Iisalo led the team.
Post-Match Reflections: Lakers: With Davis out, Los Angeles was missing 32.6 points and 11.6 rebounds a game and a dominant force in the middle. James tried to make up for the scoring but got little help.
Grizzlies: Davis' absence in the middle helped the Grizzlies stay right at their average scoring 60 points in the paint.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Memphis was shooting 48% from outside the arc at the midway point of the fourth period, while the Lakers were stuck at 25%.
